did.unittitle: Columbian College Office of the Dean records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: George Washington University. Columbian College of Arts and Sciences

did.abstract: Materials in this collection include academic guides for entering freshmen/students, original charter of Phi Beta Kappa at GW, photographs, committee on publications minutes, correspondence, Hatchet constitution, materials from the curriculum committee relating to the reform of the general education requirements for Columbian College, flags, committee on sponsored research, theses from Columbian College (including 1917 notebook on airplanes and military airplanes). The collections covers the years 1873 to 1993.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Columbian College Office of the Dean records, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Series 1 is closed to research for 25 years from date of record creation.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The George Washington University began in 1821 as The Columbian College. The College's origins can be traced to George Washington, who long argued for the creation of a university within the District of Columbia. In furtherance of that cause, Washington bequeathed 50 shares of The Potomac Company "towards the endowment of a University to be established within the limits of the District of Columbia, under the auspices of the General Government, if that government should incline to extend a fostering hand towards it." Due to congressional inaction, however, Washington's bequest was never utilized.

Aware of Washington's hopes and desirous of fostering education among missionaries and the clergy, a group of ministers and laymen raised funds for the purchase of a site for the College and petitioned Congress for a charter. The Congressional charter was approved by President Monroe on February 9, 1821 and The Columbian College was created. The name of the College was changed in 1873 to Columbian University and in 1904 to The George Washington University.

Since its founding, Columbian College, the University's original college of liberal arts and sciences, has been the cornerstone of the campus community. Its first bachelors degree was awarded in 1824, with the first Master of Arts degree following in 1831. The University awarded its first Doctor of Philosophy degree in 1888, one of the first institutions in the United States to do so.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include academic guides for entering freshmen/students, original charter of Phi Beta Kappa at GW, photographs, committee on publications minutes, correspondence, Hatchet constitution, materials from the curriculum committee relating to the reform of the general education requirements for Columbian College, flags, committee on sponsored research, theses from Columbian College (including 1917 notebook on airplanes and military airplanes). The collections covers the years 1873 to 1993.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into nine series: Sponsored research, Flags, Academic guide, Theses, Phi Beta Kappa, Curriculum committee, Committee on individual programs, Committee on publications, and Office files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of materials elated to the committee on sponsored research. The materials date from 1969.
Formerly ACC#88
This series has a paper container list in the reading room, please ask staff for assistance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of two flags for the Columbian College and Graduate School of Arts and Sciences. The materials have no ascertainable date.
Formerly ACC#312

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of academic guide for entering freshmen/students. The materials range in date from 1965-90.
Formerly ACC#388

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of ten theses from Columbian College mostly regarding national defense (including c.1917 notebook on airplanes and military airplanes), The materials range in date from 1963-67.
Formerly ACC#446
This series has a container list in electronic form, please ask staff for assistance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of original charter of Phi Beta Kappa at GW, Feb. 22, 1938; two framed photos of faculty members, The materials range in date from ca.1938.
Formerly ACC#1018

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Copies of two letters dealing with the acquisition of the items for the university archives: one from Dean Linton and the other from university archivist Sharon Galperin.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: List of faculty, seated left to right: Florence Mears, Wood Gray, George Neeley Henning, Nenry Grattan Doyle; standing left to right: Leland W. Parr, Raymond J. Seeger, Richard N. Owens, Lowell Ragatz, Robert Whitney Bolwell

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of materials from the curriculum committee related to the reform of general education requirements for Columbian College, The materials range in date from 1985-87.
Formerly RG9; formerly ACC#984
This series is unprocessed, please ask staff for assistance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of program files of students in M.A./M.S. program. The materials range in date from 1975-81.
Formerly RG10.9; formerly ACC#141
This series has a paper container list in the reading room, please ask staff for assistance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of committee on publications materials, including minutes, correspondence, Hatchet constitution, Cherry Tree. The materials range in date from 1946-51.
Formerly ACC#909

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of an application, a catalogue, reports, correspondence, and event programs. They range in date from 1873 to 1974. They concern the Isaac Davis Award in Public Speaking, the Columbian University School of Graduate Studies, "The Development and Functions of the Graduate School", the founding of the Graduate studies at Columbian University, "Plan of the Columbian University", the history graduate program, lectures, and doctoral disputation.
Formerly vertical files

Columbian College of Arts and Sciences' Float for President Barack Obama's Inaugural Parade
did.physdesc: Piece of the Columbian College of Arts and Sciences' float for President Barack Obama's Inaugural Parade. Multi-colored painted canvas, approximately 7 ft. x 8 ft., with lioness and cub from the CCAS and music notation for GW's Alma Mater. Canvas stretched on wooden frame.
